Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Titaniumgrey
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. If you walk across the road you can skirt the edge of the Tiergarten park (red squirrels can be seen) and the Berlin Zoo. It takes about 5-10 minutes and you end up right in one of the best shopping areas of Berlin. Another 5-10 minutes on and you reach KaDeWe - large stylish department store. Bar staff at the Novotel are very friendly although they sometime mix up the food order, but always sort it out. They show Sky football (German version) in the bar area. Not sure why Novotel's don't have a hand basin in the room toilets - you have to walk to the bathroom to wash your hands! Under the arches of the S-Bahn to the left of the Tiergarten station is a great little pub - Quelle. Small and not posh, but huge food portions - real Berlin. Within easy walking distance (500m) of the Berliner Siegessäule too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FernandaGVC Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location. A few steps from Tiergarten S Bahn. 2 stations from Hauptbahnhof. And of course, the breakfast is huge and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BandT50
Reviews.Content: We chose this Novotel on Hotels.com and got a very good b&b deal. As tourists, we found the location was ideal, right next door to the S-Bahn station. We bought a 3-day travel pass and used it all the time to get around. Brilliant. The hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and efficient and always ready to recommend eating places and to give directions. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. When we go to Berlin again, we shall certainly stay here. We particularly enjoyed the breakfasts before a day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: hany m
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel ,excellent service ,delicious food nice rooms only one problem bad Internet connection in public areas

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very welcoming & friendly, but desperately uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: TimBrooksbank
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming and hotel ambience was good, but the bed was so hard it was like sleeping on concrete, I got no sleep at all and now have backache. I'm told all German beds are like this, but that wasn't my experience at the hotel I stayed at the next night which had nice beds. If you like a very very hard bed then this is a nice hotel but unfortunately it's not a good choice otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “A Perdect week”
Reviews.Author: Jay175
Reviews.Content: 6 nights in Berlin, this was my third stay in this hotel. The location is great, the hotel is very good, clean, quiet and perfect for your stay in Berlin. The bar and restaurant are very good, food qulity and price are spot on. The real gem of this hotel is the staff ! Everyone of them are first class, worthy of any 5 star hotel. A great place to stay. I will go back as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Fine business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sups-mus
Reviews.Content: Fine business hotel with excellent service, large rooms, very good breakfast buffet, located immediately at the "S-Bahn" station Berlin-Tiergarten and therefore easy to reach for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne077 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right beside the S Bahn and across the road from Tiergarten. Beautiful big sparkling clean rooms. Excellent breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Only negative - charging for wifi internet access in your room - free PC in lobby was always busy - and not regulated.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: Price-quality : hard to beat, especially travelling with kids. The rooms become a bit small with the sofabed open, but....that's fast forgotten standing in front of the breakfast-buffet.Public-transportation is fantastic, we parked the car in the garage and never used it before leaving . Very good "Design"-feeling ! For all the ones not aware about the history of east and west, visit the Museum on the Check Point Charly ! As well as the Jewish Museum for the architecture and educational part (our kids loved it !) Sehr gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis ! Und gut gelegen, mitten in der Stadt und doch fast im Grünen.Öffentl. Verkehrsmittel funktionieren perfekt, haben das Auto nie benutzt während des Aufenthaltes. Die Zimmer werden etwas eng mit dem geöffnetem Schlafsofa, aber das ist schnell vergessen beim Anblick des Frühstück-Büfet. Design-Feeling ohne über-designed zu sein. Unbedingt besuchen: Museum am Check-Point-Charly und das Jüdische Museum (die päd. Abteilung ist sehr gut auch für Kinder !) Relazione prezzo-qualità e fantastico , sopra tutto viaggiando con bimbi ! Sei in centro della città ma anche nel verde (zoo, parcho), ideale affitare una bici ! Trasporto pubblico funzione perfetto (per italiani da non credere!), abbiamo lasciati la macchina in garage fin la partenza. Le stanze diventono un po ristetti con il divanoletto aperto, ma si dimentico subito davanti il buffet della colazione (anche italiani dimenticono mangiare solo un biscottino!) Tutto albergo bel design e funzionale. Da visitare: Museo al Check-Point-Charly per tutti chi non sanno tanto della storia del est-ovest. Ma anche il Museo hebraico (non solo per la architettura, ma anche per il settore educazionale .....non comei vecchi musei la catena della grande noia!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zulu_Warrior77
Reviews.Content: Novatel Berlin Am Tiergarten was recomended to us by a friend who stayed there last year and we were not disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located right by the S-Bahn station and the beautiful Tiergarten Park. For a breath of fresh air and as an alternative to using public transport, it itakes about 45 minutes to walk through Tiergarten Park along Straße des 17 Juni, past the Victory Column to the Brandenburg gate. Staff were very friendly, efficient and knowledgable and gave us advice on where to find good restaurants and routes to take on the S-Bahn and Underground. There is free access to the internet in a private area off the foyer and reception staff helpfully printed off our reservation confirmations for our visits to the Reichstag and Berlin Philharmonic. The wide variety of food available at breakfast was wonderful, hot and cold meats, smoked salmon, cheeses, fruit, cereals, eggs cooked in any style you wished, jams, honey, every type of bread, fresh fruit juices, hot drinks and much more. Our room was adequately spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet (we requested a quiet room when making our booking). We booked a five night stay including breakfast, paid in full at the time of booking to obtain a good price (but unable to cancel), and this was excellent value for money. We would have no reservation in recommending Novatel Berlin Am Tiergarten as a good value for money hotel to use as a base for a holiday in the magnificent city of Berlin and we fully intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bmac59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and two teenage children in family room. Room good size and one of the best buffet breakfasts I have ever had each morning so advise you go for this included. There is a good gym on the roof with sauna and our children used this frequently. There is free internet in the lobby and we would enjoy a drink whilst the kids went on the computers. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and security was very evident as you could not use the lift or stairs to the rooms without your key pass. This Novotel is a good 45 minute walk from the centre, but that didn't bother us as there is so much to see on the way and a walk through the Tiergarten is delightful.- there is the train station almost outside if you don't want to walk and the fare is very cheap. Will stay again when I return definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time at the Novotel Am Tiergarten. With roomy, modern rooms, friendly staff and a great breakfast buffet. Ideally located at Tiergarten S-Bahn station, you're only a few U-Bahn rides away from the main sights of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hotelbuster Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times before and can highly recommend it. If you book the city- break alternative you will get the wonderful breakfastbuffe included in the price. The s- bahn station Tiergarten is on the other side of the street. Enjoy the wellbeing area on 6 th floor with a minigym and saunas.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were excellent speaking fluent English. Breakfast was excellent - plenty of choice of cooked and cold food Rooms were clean & tidy - TV in rooms with a couple of english channels Good location for visiting Central park, Zoo, etc Railway Station adajent to Hotel with frequent trains (every 10 minutes) into Central Berlin and further a field. Our room overlooked railway station and no noise could be heard.

Reviews.Title: “Room with Tiergarten/skyline view”
Reviews.Author: Philippe1963
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (S-Bahn to Mitte or Zoo, "next door"), spacious, nicely-designed and quiet rooms (request park-view), helpful staff, excellent breakfast-buffet. Price/quality/service: very good. Only drawback: no wifi ... which should be changed!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: S3by87
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the location is superb. It's in West Berling, and you can reach easily all major interest points: the Parliament Building, the Berlin Wall, The Zoo etc. The hotel is fairy new, the staff very professional, large clean rooms, free internet if you are an A-Club Member.

Reviews.Title: “downright excellent”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGeographer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip to Berlin accompanied by my older son. The hotel is located in an excellent spot right opposite the main S-Bahn artery and offers all the frill and whistles (or not) that the Novotel chain holds in store for its visitors (the 'or not' is a recognition that the chain still charges for WiFi access). It's a fairly new hotel, staff is excellent and friendly (WiFi didn't work in my room - they relocated me on the spot). Breakfast is above average even by Novotel standards. I did not explore the nearby Tiergarten even though it looked splendid in the autumn sunshine. All said, I'll return - not the least because of the ease of access and mobility afforded by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great, good service, noice level in rooms to be optimized (window sound absorbation when sleeping on the street side. Fitness center maybe to be extended with 2 or 3 additional equipment than at rush hour you don't want to be in the queu

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: magic_maggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with a group of 80 people who were going to the ICC/MESSE for a Congress. It does not look so nice from the outside... but it was a good surprise! The price of the rooms was very reasonable, rooms are well equipped (tea/coffee facilities, separate WC, confortable beds, bath AND shower). Breakfast is really good. Not many restaurants/bars in the area but you can take the metro (station is 100m away) and in 2 stops you're in a place full of restaurants. We had meetings organised at the hotel on the first 2 days and everything went pretty smoothly (despite the fact they changed the rooms without informing us...). Staff onsite were quite helpful. We would definitely go back if we have another Congress in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Vermeer123
Reviews.Content: It is a nice business hotel, but we had a good deal for a weekend in Berlin. Breakfast is huge, great variety. Convenient located near the S bahn Tiergarten

Reviews.Title: “FOR A CONVENTION ATTENDEE - JUST RIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: jzkpmd
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Berlin Am Tiergarten is just beside the S line enroute to a singel transfer to Messe Nord where the International Convention Center is. For a convention attendee, this is so convenient. Not only that, you don't have to walk more than 75 maters to the train stop to get to all parts of Berlin. The Novotel is a business hotel but my room was a third larger than most European Hotel rooms ( bigger than my Le Meridien Etoile Hotel room ). The king-sized bed was comfy enough and I had a bathtub, shower and a separate toilet. Amenities were adequate. There was a room safe and ref. The rooms were cleaned everyday. The only this a missed were CNN, movies were in GErman but I had Sky News, BBC and Bloomberg in English. Though there were two computers with printers in the ground floor for guests' use, there should have been free WiFi in the rooms or at least in the lobby. Food was standard but not spectacular but the restaurant staff were accommodating and efficient and they understood English.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: TukkiPa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the room was nice. The only problem was that with 2 beds, if someone was sitting at the desk, you could not get past that person to get to the one bed. I think the room was small by US standards . The bed was comfortable and the room clean. The hotel was right next to the Tiergarten stop of the S-Bahn. There was not a lot to see close to the hotel. The City Circle tour bus picked up right in front of the hotel. We booked it under a special promotion and paid 930 Euros for 10 nights, which included a very nice buffet breakfast with made to order omelets. There was plenty to see in Berlin for that length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxGirl_46
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the usual quality of accommodation and service that I would expect from a Novotel. The location is good: not in the centre of things (ie no restaurants, cafes or shops nearby), but there is an S-Bahn station right opposite which takes you to the centre of the action in minutes and the area is quiet at night. If you don’t mind walking, you can walk through the Tiergarten to the Brandenburg gate. We stayed here for the Marathon weekend and I was so impressed with the way the hotel catered for the runners. The pasta buffet on the Saturday night was a great idea and very much appreciated. They also did an early breakfast on the morning of the race. We ate in the hotel more than we normally would, and found the food to be good, if unspectacular, and the service was charming, as it was at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit garanteed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was enjoyable. I find the location very convenient with the S-Bahn right there and connections to everywhere. Also within close distance to the Tiergarten. All the major attraction are close by. The next time I come to Berlin, I will definately stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Novotel Tiergarten before and can really recommend it. It has a very nice Sauna and wellness-area, the breakfast is really good (you may have to pay 19 euro/person for it if it's not included in the price) and the location is right next to the central metro line that takes you to Zoologischer Garten, Haupbahnhof and Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pjm1963
Reviews.Content: If Your Going to Berlin for Business the Novotel is Perfect as much for the Location & overall peformance of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for family stay”
Reviews.Author: OritSagi
Reviews.Content: Good location near zoo and Tiergarten park. nice room, comfortable for 2 adults an 2 kids.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, Clean, excellent customer service, modern”
Reviews.Author: PrinceandPrincessMom
Reviews.Content: We arrived Berlin early and went to the hotel at 12pm or so, the room was ready. We found out the shower was plugged the first night and the front desk moved us to a different room immediately. The room is of a good size for a family of four, the breakfast is the best in our 3 week trip in Italy and Germany. My husband used the gym facilities and liked it. The ventilation in the washroom worked like magic, it was complete silence and yet there was never steam after the showers. The front desk staff is very helpful, especially Anika, giving advice to different sight seeing places, booked our taxi to the airport, etc. We ate at the hotel restaurant one cold rainy evening in August. There were only three tables when we were there, the service was immaculate, the food was delicious,the price was very reasonable. They offer a 3 course children meal and drink for children 12 or under, for E12. The M&M ice cream dessert at the end was a real surprise. We paid E5 earlier near the Parliament building for the same thing but had much less ice cream, less M&M, and not decorated as nearly attractive. There was candlelight on the dinner table, no rush, no noise, we didn't have to bring our wallet even, that was the easiest, most relaxed, enjoyable meal in our entire trip. The only little minus is that, the one playstation at the play area is always taken up, my 9 year old son didn't have a chance to play even once during our 4 nights stay. However, we didn't go to Berlin to play Playstation, so it's not a big deal. The flea market on Sat and Sun was a unique experience, if you have time, try spending a couple hours there. Taxi between the hotel and the international airport ranges from E15to E20. If there is anything to make this even a better hotel, maybe add some laundry facilities within the hotel. Berlin was our last stop in our 3 week trip, and with a family of four, paying the outside laundry service item by item was just too expensive. Overall, we have very pleasant experience with this hotel, and will recommend this to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin stopover”
Reviews.Author: neillygb Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sought out a Novotel as with our 4 kids 3-13 they are one of the only hotels to agree with the sane world that anyone under 16 is a child and allow them to stay free in parents room. We had 2 rooms each with a double & a double sofa bed so ample room for even more kids than we have and due to family offers (2nd room half price) works out very reasonable. Staff were excellent and couldn't have been more helpful, internet access in foyer and kids play area is always useful. Breakfast (kids eat free) amongst the best at any hotel we've stayed at. Tiergarten is a great place to stay in Berlin, right near the S Bahn for a few stops into the centre and a walk from Tiergarten park and the Zoological Gardens. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, location was not as great as expected”
Reviews.Author: MLK170
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two teenagers and thought it was a "family" hotel. Okay I guess if you have little ones, but there is no way my two teenagers could fit in the pull out bed. I also didn't think the reception staff was very helpful or friendly. We asked them how to get to the Kudamm when we first arrived and the gal pointed to a direction and said walk this way 15 minutes. No map and no actual directions. We then discovered she meant to walk through the park - which was not obvious at first. Also, one night when we were coming back from dinner, we saw three prostitutes standing outside our hotel. Nice education for my teenager son. I hadn't been to Berlin in 30 years, so thought being close to the Kudamm would be best. Next time I'll stay by in the newer hotels on the eastern side.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: martinandreassen
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin by car and parked at the cellar under the hotel - very easy. The hotel is fairly new and thus very modern. The staff at the reception were very frindly during the entire stay and they spoke good English language. We were a family of four and the kids slept in a couch in the room (kids under 16 are free of charge). The room was very nice and was kept clean during the entire stay. The complimentary breakfast was very good and there were so many things to choose from so the family was very happy each morning. The fitness center at the 6. floor was also very good. Only minus about the hotel is that wi-fi is not complimentary! The hotel is located 10 min. walk from the great zoo which is an absolute must if you stay for some days. The hotel is also located right next to Tiergarten station which gives you easy access to all places in Berlin. If you are a family we recommend buying a one-day train ticket (covering the entire family). The price is EUR 15 and the ticket is also sold at the hotel reception. Remember to verify your ticket at the train station. There is no recommedable restaurants near the hotel but we often took the train and metro (U6) to Oranienburger Tor where we found several nice restaurants. We will definetely come back should we come to Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Interalios
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Berlin am Tiergarten in July 2011. The hotel is very conveniently located for central Berlin (S Bahn is right outside of the hotel and only takes a few minutes to get into the centre of the City). The hotel is modern, clean and has good amenities. There is a great variety of food for breakfast and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel bar is also nice and, for a hotel at least, not that expensive. In summary, the hotel represents very good value for money with good facilities and a great location. I would definately return if I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: VikramRanade
Reviews.Content: This is located just next to the Tram station (barely 20 meters) and is in a really nice area of Berlin.Lots of green and wide roads and walkways.It is 1 tram stop away from Zoologisher Garten where there are lots of places to eat and hang out.The Breakfast setup is really good with a good spread. However they have poor internet access facilities in the common area with with a poorly configured Mac. Also like all Novotels in Germany their TV system is not the best (some philips TV that is very sluggish).room quality is very good and excellent mattresses for good sleeping comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for stay”
Reviews.Author: jen158
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days for sightseeing in Berlin. Hotel is next to S-bahn and provides great breakfast. It is nice to stay with reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: lnbn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 with our children aged 9 and 14. The room was quite big and contained everything we needed for our 2 nights stay; in short a regular hotel room with bathroom, TV, minibar. We especially liked that there was a separate shower and bathtub. Everything was very clean and nice; probably renovated lately. The breakfast was excellent! On the downside was that the beds were a bit hard and that the parking (in a garage under the hotel) was expensive, but overall we were pleasantly surprised and would really recommend it to anyone visiting Berlin, especially if you are planning to visit the Berlin zoo since it was close by, just a stroll through the park to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great business hotel at a fantastic rate for a large European city. The hotel is great, nice clean rooms, looks recently refurbished. It is located very near the Tiergarten train station and the Tiergarten park itself. Food options in the immediate vicinity are scarce though. Please avoid the Burger King at the train station and head to the "Tiergartenquelle" just a couple minutes walk from the hotel. Great German food, great German beer at a very reasonable price. My only problem with the hotel is that it does not have free wifi in the lobby, which has become the norm in many business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: renangautier Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is very impressive. Location: very good, next to S-Bahn Station (direct link to airport), opposite tiergarten (very big park), just one stop away from the main shopping area. Hotel Rooms: good rooms size, deco, bed, toilets. Good buffet breakfast as well. As most hotels in berlin have see thru toilet, this hotel doesnt, so it is good if you are travelling with friends or sibblings

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_skywalker
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I asked for a quiet room as I was exhausted- reception responded to this by giving me a 'free upgrade,' which resulted in a wonderful room.It was extremely quiet, clean and spacious. When you get off the lift they have big tables that are filled with free fruit and newspapers in the morning and posh biscuits in the afternoon. The location is great- just across the street from the Tiergarten S-Bahn. The hotel is surrounded by traffic but I could not hear any of it in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexacasper Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11 am. Normally check in is about 3 pm but our room was already cleaned so check in was quick and easy. The room was very clean, large and nice. Every night we had a great sleep! The breakfast buffet was wonderfull with lots of variety for everybody. The hotel is ideally located next to the S-bahn station Tiergarten, which is ideal to discover the city. The Tiergarten park is just steps away from the hotel. Here you can stroll and relax. Overall highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ozrick33Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is what one would expect from the Novotel chain. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had room service once and the food was very good. Pleasant staff and the internet in the reception area is very handy. The location is brilliant, just two minutes from the train station. Very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, let down by the detail...”
Reviews.Author: 60-degreese-North
Reviews.Content: When checking in, ask for a room AWAY from the railway line, which makes a noise all day / evening long and starts again at 5am in the morning... Very nice hotel, but lacking in attention to detail: for example, why have I had to ASK every day for a breakfast form to order in my room - why can't room service LEAVE one? Same with black tea bags... A request for breakfast Cornflakes - resulted in Frosties (definitely OFF the diet list for a diabetic...very frustrating). These stupid issues make the stay frustrating - and won't entice me back - that and the WiFi - a swingeing 9.90 a day - time to make this FREE novotel!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE COMFORTABLE HOTEL IN THE TIERGARTEN DISTRICT”
Reviews.Author: fredspurgin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and it was one of those hotels I look forward to staying in. The hotel is adjacent to Tiertarten U/S Bahn station which is handy in itsself. The rooms are reasonable size with a sofa and flat screen tv (you can get sky news which is always handy for brits). If you are into antiques then there is an antiques market right outside the door saturday-sundays and it is good sized market too. Not the cheapest but you get what you pay for with hotels and thus I think it is reasonably priced for the comfort level.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Tiergarten”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel, close to the S Bahn (stop Tiergarten). Within a few minutes you are at Hauptbahnhof and in the city centre. The hotel rooms are luxurious with bath and shower. The windows can be opened. The breakfast buffet has a great choice. We can recommend this hotel which offers value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Pleasurable Hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: MaineislandgalBH
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Berlin we found the Novotel in Berlin to be a comfortable escape at the end of long, cold day of touring Berlin by foot and U-Bahn. Room had queen bed only but had plenty of room to fit a King sized bed but that was my only complaint. Shower had plentiful supply of hot water and water pressure and we were on the top floor. The Novotel is a 2 minute walk to the Spittlemarkt stop of the U2 train of the U-Bahn, which allowed for easy access to all of Berlin. Breakfast buffett was a large selection of traditional German breakfast samplings. Bread, eggs, sausages, bread, waffles, muesli, bread, cheeses, cold meats and did i mention bread? Not just plain old toast bread but an assortment of many styles of bread. If I were to visit Berlin again I would not hesitate to book at this Novotel again as it met all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter123452
Reviews.Content: Been at the hotel in 2007 and came back. Hotel is located in the very center of berlin, next to Tiergarten park (closer to the western part of Berlin). on foot, It is about 15 minutes walk to Kudamn and 40 minutes to Brandeenburg Gate. Across the street form the hotel there is a S-Bahn station, which makes getting around town much easier. Srevice was great - staff is polite and vert attentive. Rooms are spacious and very clean - ask for a room facing the inner courtyard, it is much quieter than rooms facing the street. Breakfast is one of the best I had in Europe - a huge selsction of cold and hot dishes. For the price, I beleive this is one of the best hotels in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great hotel, clean room. well located but quite calm area!! the breakfast had been left in the room..... it was very smelly when we came back at night..... apart from that, very nice and polite staff

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected, good value”
Reviews.Author: ArtsnSciences
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a mid-level "value" hotel on par with Holiday Inn or Radisson, but this turned out to be a lot nicer than I expected! Location is right next to the Tiergarten S-bahn station, not exactly the centre of action, but neighborhood is a little iffy. Still, this is Berlin, so it's pretty safe. Room was small but more than adequate and nicely done. Breakfast was a feast with several meats, cheeses, breads, eggs, fruit, cereals, salads. Room price was very good value considering normal prices in Berlin. Definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: ClauMiya
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the hotel. Rooms are clean, space enough for 2 adults and 1 kid. The staff is always helpful. We will stay there again if we have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: canadiansteve1982
Reviews.Content: Excellent leisure stay at this hotel. It is in an excellent location right beside tiergarten and tiergarten train station and a 30 minute walk to potsdamer platz. Rooms are of a very high standard and exceptionally clean. Service in the bar and restaurant was good. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: itai12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staffs. Very nice and great location too.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel helped make my stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: We saw the hotel when we were on the train! Needless to say we thrilled we didn't have to walk around for ages until we found the hotel - first impressions were really good as a key location is important to me. Check-in was easy and simple - despite a name change on my part - we had no problem which I was anticipating. All staff are fantastic English speakers and could not do enough to help us. One receptionist 'Julienne' was incredibly helpful to me and my sister helping us book tickets and giving us all information that we required for sightseeing - she was better than the tourist information at the airport! The rooms were lovely - we had infact booked a room for 4 people but only 2 of us could make it in the end but the room would have been a tight squeeze for 4 adults but for 2 it was perfect. The only English channels are sky news and bbc news (but MTV) and as we did have to spend 1 night in the hotel that was annoying - but the room was clean, quiet and we were happy to read instead. I don't normally come abroad to stay in but we had to so it would have been good to have a bit more choice. There is a bar downstairs and spa facilities on the 6th floor aswell though. The breakfast was out of this world there was everything and anything on offer! Freshly made omelettes, fruit, sausages, eggs, bacon, cheese, salmon, cereal, toast, pastries, juices, coffee, tea, flavoured teas, hot chocolates, yoghurts - amazing. The breakfast totally set us up for the day aswell. We also ate in the restaurant for dinner and although a little pricey - the food was amazing. Cornelius the bar man was really helpful in recommending portion sizes etc. On Saturdays and Sundays there is a massive flea market that goes on outside the hotel (not noisy) and definitely worth a look! We also really liked the fact that you can pick up the circle line tour (bus tour) outside the hotel too. We got the train to the TV Tower which was so close on the train and Charlottenburg Palace is closely to the hotel too. From the train location aswell you can very easily get to Potsdam for a day which I recommend! Overall this hotel completely made our trip with its easy travel links, friendly, helpful, English speaking staff, great food and lovely rooms. Would recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, next to s-bahn, max really for families of 4”
Reviews.Author: Richard10024
Reviews.Content: The hotel was across the street from the S-bahn train and 2 stops from the central train station. if you have a train or eurail pass - this is a good location as there are frequent trains. The hotel attracts a lot of families. The rooms are really geared for families of 4. The staff was pleasant on most things we asked about. But in terms of food and other recommendations - they didn't recommend anything other than their hotel restaurant. Their elevators were quite slow. If you are looking for a clean, safe, non-charming hotel next to the s-bahn this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with the dream breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Fisutrip
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near by the beautiful Tiergarten park. Top position if you like like jogging. The rooms are quite small, but very clean and comfortable. The best breakfast I've ever eaten at any hotel, it deserves 5 stars. Fantastic service. Definitely recommended. The only minus is the location, it's far from Mitte, etc, although the train station is near.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Anneandfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights - very friendly staff, very clean and very good position for exploring Berlin. Our stay included breakfast each morning and we found the choice to be excellent - the staff were very efficient as well. Overall, I would highly recommend the Hotel for a trip to Berlin. We managed to walk almost everywhere (although the cyclists in the Park were very scary). In the evening we went down near the Zoo and ate there on a couple of occasions (there were quite a few restaurants, quite reasonable). On the last evening we managed to find a small pub right near the Hotel (Tiergarten Quelle). This was very good - the meals were very reasonable and very good and the staff there were very friendly. It was very busy with locals as well which is a good recommendation. I wish we had found this place earlier!! This was just by the Station. Overall we had a great time and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: wdarrah
Reviews.Content: Nice, new hotel. Great location by main S bahn corridor. I would equate it with a Holiday in the US: nice franchise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ForzaLupi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best novotel I have ever stayed in. It was so warm and cosy especially after coming in from sub-zero temperatures outside! The staff were willing to cater for all our needs and the breakfast was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: klausellegaard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located literally next to Tiergarten train station which is well-connected to the rest of Berlin's trains (Berlin has overground S-trains and underground U-trains, Tiergarten is an S-station. Stations nearby connect to the U-trains, tickets are valid on boh S- and U-trains). The hotel is very much a business hotel with conferencing facilities and so on which isn't of much use when on a leisure trip. However, it also has a fitness center and an Xbox for the kids (which was great as the kids could use it when they got impatient at dinner). Being a business-type hotel, the restaurant was fairly expensive (the breaskfast couldn't really justify the price of EUR 18, but there is an excellent bakery at the station a few meters from the main entrance). The hotel is located in the Tiergarten - a huge park in the middle of Berlin. This limits the number of restaurants in the immediate area. Actually, there is a Burger King and Berlin's only "Hooters" restaurant nearby - and not much else. This isn't an issue as the train will take you all over Berlin for dinner and night life. The rooms in the hotel are large, easily accommodating the standard double-bed, an extra bed AND a cot, making it possible for a family to stay in one room. The rooms are very quiet, a lot of effort seems to have gone into sound proofing it, both between rooms and from the rather busy street outside. With the windows closed and the A/C on, the temperature in the room was comfortable and it was very quiet. All in all, an excellent place to stay with perfect connections to the rest of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Berlin from”
Reviews.Author: slinkyhippo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days. The hotel is nice and modern and right next to the tiergarten station and the tiergarten itself. The rooms are large enough and the rates were good. The hotel bar is well stocked and the staff friendly. The prices at the hotel bar are a little on the high side, but that is to be expected in a 4 star central city hotel. We didn't opt for breakfast as at 18Eur we thought it was over priced considering you can eat breakfast at local restuarants for half that amount. The only slight downside was a constant banging noise that seemed to start around 7am and continued, but I think that was just something that was happening while we were there. Overall a good hotel and well worth staying in if you are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great room and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Skjeldsen
Reviews.Content: Good quiet room with nice modern decor. Separate toilet and bath room, The bath room had both a tub and a shower. Big flatscreen and option to make a cup of coffee or tea in the room. Breakfast is plentifull and you can order omelets etc. Location is just at a tube station so yu can get to the center of things in 5 minutes but the local area is without many places tot eat or hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Top class for a 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: ippok
Reviews.Content: clean hotel, friendly staff, big rooms, free fitness service, etc. Everything working well in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: JennyJK
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a convenient location with a wonderful breakfast! The only thing on the negative side was the sofa bed which was not at all comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazingmuppet
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three nights at this hotel with my partner. The room is a very generic Novotel room, it's clean and spacious however the room lacks character but at least we knew that we wouldn't be disappointed when we got there. The room was spacious with a very large bed and sofa however the toilet was separate to the bathroom which was a little strange. Also, we were only given one pillow and there weren't any spares in the room. Breakfast buffet was included with our room booking and was fantastic. There was so much choice (eggs, sausages, smoked salmon, german sausage etc) although I probably wouldn't pay the €18per person if it wasn't included. Also, avoid Hooters opposite as the food there was awful. Location wise, the hotel is great if you want to be near to Berlin Zoo and the shops and restaurants that surround the Zoo as It is only a 15 minute walk to the zoo. From Tegel airport, we took the X9 bus to Zoologischer Garten (costs €2.10) and walked to the hotel. We took a taxi back to the airport and that cost €15. It was some distance to walk to central Berlin, took about 40 minutes through the Tiergarten.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: grahamstevens
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here in early May on a short break in Berlin. The hotel's two great advantages are location and value. While it is a good 2km from the true centre of Berlin, the Tiergarten S-Bahn stop is just across the street and makes getting around Berlin easy. Prices are very reasonable although, as it is primarily a business hotel, they do vary widely depending on trade fairs etc. The breakfast buffet is excellent and I would strongly recommend taking B&B terms if available. Rooms are fairly large and have a modern style although there are a few things that didn't impress us. Firstly, the toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom and has no sink - not especially hygenic especially if somebody else is using the bathroom at that time. Secondly, just one small pillow is supplied per person with no spares - ask at reception for more if needed. Thirdly, as there is construction work taking place 50 metres from mthe hotel, we left the window shut. Each night the air con cut out during the night and we woke up feeling feelin less than comfortable. Just add that we used the free internet in the lobby and had no problem using it whenever we wanted. Can't comment on the hotel restaurant (apart from the excellent breakfast) as we ate out every evening. We found four restaurants within 400 yards of the hotel - including Hooters just opposite which proved less tacky than we expected. Best by far was (I think called) Tiergarten Quelle which is on Bachstrasse just beyond the second entrance to the S-Bahn station. Reasonable prices, great local food and beer and packed with locals. Overall, a pretty good hotel and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 4 star hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: maltesesun
Reviews.Content: The Positives Exceptionally good service at front desk which instantly makes you feel welcome and gives you a good impression of the hotel. Rooms are spacious (approx 30 sqm), nice bathroom with separate bath and shower and WC in separate room. Lots of wardrobe space for coats and suits. Safe and minibar. There is an Ironing Room on the 3rd floor. Lifts only work if a valid room key is inserted. The Negatives Internet very expensive at Eur 19 per 24 hrs. Room service menu is very limited. The room service phone number is not listed on the menu. The phone in the room did not have a shortcut key to room service. All this led me to believe that the hotel doesn't like doing room service! To place a room service order, I started trying the shortcut buttons. I first tried front desk, they tried to put me through, but eventually the line went dead. I tried another number and got through to the restaurant. As I wanted something different to what was on the menu, the restaurant host offered a club sandwich with fries. This was delivered in just under 20 minutes. As soon as the waitress left, I realised that the fries were not delivered. I called the restaurant again and was told that fries were all gone but they can do wedges instead. These were eventually delivered 15 minutes later. Food quality was good. Another minor detail which got me confused was that the room phone was marked with the wrong room number. This caused a bit of confusion when I was placing the room service order. Just across the road from the hotel, there is Hooters Restaurant, very affordable and nice busy atmosphere. Train station is also across the road from hotel. During rush hour, Taxi from Tegel to hotel cost me Eur 25 while the trip back at 7am took no more than 15 minutes, costing Eur 15. For ITB fair delegates, the hotel offered complimentary transfers to Messe Berlin in the morning and afternoon, with coaches leaving every 20 mins. Unfortunately, I did not use the fitness, bar and restaurant this time. But will definitely do so next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base to explore Berlin from”
Reviews.Author: Wilkos2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in snowy Berlin. We had never stayed with Novotel before. The staff at the hotel could not have been kinder or more helpful, nothing was too much trouble for the receptionists. Our room was a superior room on the sixth floor with its own balcony and with views out over Berlin. The bedroom was nice and large with a comfortable bed and plenty of storage space. The heating system was very effective. Both the bedroom and bathroom were kept very clean. Breakfast was excellent, one of the best spreads we've seen. We did not have any evening meals in the restaurant so cannot comment on these. On a couple of nights we enjoyed Tapas meals in the lounge bar which were delicious. There was a choice of 3,6 or 9 dishes from a long list which included 3 dessert dishes. Again staff really friendly. The hotel is right across the road from the Tiergarten S Bahnhof. Having looked at maps in guide books we expected to have a bit of a walk to the hotel from the station so it was a pleasant surprise to walk out of the station and see the hotel right ahead of us. We did not mind hearing trains passing by but not everyone might. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again. It was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “no internet?!”
Reviews.Author: jottrip
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fine, but I just realized there's no WLAN in the room. The cable is pretty short, so it's impossible working from the bed. The room itself is very nice and the Hotel is pretty in the middle of everything. Anyways I don't like if the staff is not emphasizing to an obvious business traveler there's no WLAN in the room. Cable LAN is about 20€ per day, but day counts from 12 to 12 midnight. Otherwise it's 0,30€ per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Ozziegirl007
Reviews.Content: First impressions of hotel were very good. Large reception area with a modern feel. Staff at check in were friendly and helpful and offered to store our luggage as our room wasn't ready. Once we arrived in our room it hadn't been properly cleaned and the sofa bed for our son had not been made up. However this was our only critisism of the hotel and once mentioned at reception it was promptly rectified. Overall we found this to be a good hotel in an excellent location and would definitely recommend. Good value for money especially the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “classy and modern”
Reviews.Author: rockofsense
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Novotel, Berlin-Tiergarten. This is a modern and classy hotel. Ask for rooms facing East, or better still South, and you will have fantastic views over the Tiergarten - Berlin's equivalent of Central Park, only much bigger. It is within walking distance to the City West shopping area. Also beside the train station connecting one to all areas of the city. Friendly staff, nice bright rooms with all modern appliances, great breakfast buffet and a totally relaxing atmosphere. A five star feel for a four star price1

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: madejlock
Reviews.Content: Picked this location because of other reviews on TripAdvisor and they were spot on. This is a great location, especially if traveling with young children, as the train station is directly across the street. Once you master Berlin's amazing transportation system, you'll be quite happy about the hotel's location. The rooms were bright and comfy and breakfast was great. Only downside is that there are not really any 'kid friendly' restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely in the center of Berlin, but the center of Berlin is a massive park (the Tiergarten), so the location is a bit more remote than you might expect. It is a about a 15 minute (very safe) walk to the nearest commercial area where you will find shops, cafes etc. That being said, it is directly across from the Tiergarten S-Bahn, so it is convenient to get anywhere in the city. But, if you are coming back at night after the S-Bahn stops running, taxis are expensive in Berlin with the current excahnge rate; our very short trip from Nollendorfplatz was about 9 Euros. Now, for the good news. The hotel is extremely modern and clean. The rooms are large and pleasant; very comfortable. They are running a summer promotion in 2009 of 69 Euros a night, which is a steal for the quality of the hotel and its location. The staff is extremely warm and friendly; very helpful. There are bikes onsite which you can rent, which is great fun in Berlin and was very convenient. The only odd thing about the hotel itself is they told us that our floor did not have WiFi, and on the floors that did have WiFi, it was very expensive: 25 Euros for 24 hours. However, we were oddly able to pick up a T-Mobile hotspot at the hotel, which worked fine, and was 29 Euros for 30 days! I am not sure if the hotel knows that this hotspot is undercutting its internet option, but if they don't, that's kind of suprising! In short, I liked this hotel, but on my next trip to Berlin, I may want to stay in a neighborhood with more activity.

Reviews.Title: “mid range hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerscarlett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the price range. As one reviewer said the rooms are awkwardly arranged. We had two young children with us so there were four of us in the room and we found the room very cramped with very little storage place for clothes etc. and also very little space to put toiletries in the bathroom. The toilet and bathroom are separate but could use a small hand sink in the toilet. The carpet was dirty with a lot of stains on it and the housekeeping was hit and miss but always adequate even if they would usually leave something out. On the plus side the breakfast was excellent. We found the staff to be helpful and nice at all times. The hotel was one stop from the zoo and on a direct line to alexander platz in the other direction. Even though we were right beside a train line we couldn't hear it in the room with the windows closed and the air-conditioning was great. We stayed a week and found it great as a base. If we were staying longer we would have probably need a larger room for the four of us. I would definitely recommend it as there were only minor irritants and could easily be overcome. The price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and will again go back”
Reviews.Author: nialldoheny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in mid- July. My partner and I were in town for the U2 concert. Have stayed here a few times in the past and chose the hotel because of it's central location and indeed the good price they offered. As expected, everything was well up to standard, including spankling clean rooms, an amazing breakfast choice, and generally quite pleasant staff. All in all, yes we would go back and the location speaks volumes. Beside the Tiergarten S-Bahn stop, only a short stroll to Zoo and central West Berlin. Oh, they've opened a Hooters restaurant just opposite now!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sloughboy
Reviews.Content: needed hotel for one night in central location that was good. Right next to the the tiergarten station so easy access straight into central berlin. nice rooms, staff couldve been friendlier but they did make changes when we asked them to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfromspain
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at how close to the Tier Garten S-bahn train station this hotel was. It's also in the middle of the park so the place is very quiet but a short train ride away from many sights and points of interest. There hotel feels a little isolated but there is a Burger King right next to it and lots of shops and restaurants only one S-bahn station away. The staff were nice and efficient. The rooms were nice, very clean and well maintained and looked like new. My wife loved the square bed pillows because they were very comfortable. The breakfast was also very nice with a good choice of food at the buffet and they don't start taking things away twenty minutes before closing time as they do at many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a New Year”
Reviews.Author: jimansandra
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for a New Year break in Berlin. And what a superb hotel with some of the best staff we have encountered. We booked a 3 night stay with 2 friends through Ryanair and took advantage of a very cheap flight and hotel deal. We wanted to be near the main festivities for new years Eve and we had a 20 to 30 minute walk towards the Brandenburg Gate area where there was a huge party taking place. We took the train from the airport at Schonefeld directly to Tiergarten and the hotel is just across the road from the station. The trains are cheap to use and we had access to most areas within the city in a matter of minutes. The hotel rooms are large and exceptionally comfortable, the staff excellent and we would not hesitate to return here if visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on all criteria”
Reviews.Author: Art20thC
Reviews.Content: All I can do is confirm what so many others have already written. Undoubtably the best Novotel I have ever stayed at yet the lowest priced. Every aspect was excellent and professional- breakfast was fantastic, rooms were spotless, location across a sidestreet from the Tiergarten S-bahnhof is so convenient. They have a much better wi-fi deal than other Novotels, where you can get a voucher that lasts from 6pm til the next morning. I even got a thankyou letter from management welcoming me back whenever I am in Berlin. I would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Berlin Am Tiergarten”
Reviews.Author: DrRichards
Reviews.Content: Novotel Berlin Am Tiergarten was a modern, well-furnished, clean hotel. Everything you would expect from a 4* business hotel. The location was excellent, situated directly opposite a train station which has links to central Berlin, the train takes only 5 or so minutes. The breakfast was amazing, with a wide selection to suit everyone, including; cooked breakfast, pastries, fruit, yogurts, ham and cheese, a chef ready to cook omelettes and waffles to order and more. The bedroom was clean, with a nice en-suite bathroom. The hotel exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lehovec
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a step away from S-Bahn station Tiergarten and is located on the main street, but has double glazed windows so no noise. Lobby is very modern and clean, reception staff polite and efficient. Had a superior room on 5th floor (the building has some 15 floors, however hotels goes up to the 6th floor). Rooms were big, modern, nicely furnishered. Had all amenities (safe, mini bar, wireless...). The only minus was the bed. It was quite uncomfortable and didn't have a great sleep. Didn't bother with breakfast as our rate did not include it and it was priced at €17 per person. Instead we walked to the bakery on the S-bahn stop and had lovely breakfast for €8 for both. Bar looks lovely, can't comment on the prices as we rather had a drink in the centre. Hotel is some 20-25 minutes to the Brandeburg gate walking through the park. I would reccomend this hotel however beware of beds which could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: pandoras_chocolates
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference hosted at the Novotel in early June. I booked a room directly with the hotel, and found that the "conference rate" wasn't available any longer, but they were able to offer me a much cheaper rate -- which of course, I grinned and bore. The hotel is modern, well maintained, clean and tidy, and comfortable. My room was spacious, with a large bathroom, big comfortable bed, and lots of work space. I had to work late one evening, and it was easy to find lots of desk space for papers, laptop, etc. Wireless was expensive, but do ask at the front desk for a "business" rate, as they will sell you five days of wireless access for a much more reasonable rate! Breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice, good coffee, and friendly service. I ate in the restaurant one evening, and had a few drinks in the bar while the football was on, and the service was excellent. The hotel's location is quite convenient, near to the Tiergarten and Zoo, about a 10-15 minutes walk to the Zoo Bahnhof. Admittedly I didn't need to get around much, but there's a subway stop next to the hotel. Overall, I was very happy with my stay - definitely one of the most comfortable hotels I've stayed at recently, and a very good location to hold a large (> 150 people) conference.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with kid-friendly facilities.”
Reviews.Author: EugeC
Reviews.Content: Great location across the street from a train stop. Modern decor and clean. One of the more kid-friendly hotels that we've stayed at, featuring a play area with toys and electronic games. Free Internet access at this area. However, at least when we stayed, the hotel didn't seem to have many guests, leading to an eerie, quiet atmosphere. The rooms were slightly awkwardly arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: emjaykay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. Location is excellent with a taxi stand directly outside the hotel and an S-Bahn (overhead railway) station a few metres away from the hotel, just turn left outside the front door and you're on the right track!! Booked the hotel through the accorhotels.com website and obtained a really excellent rate using the Accor Favourite Guest Card. Check in was smooth ... was given keys to a room with one double bed when a room with twin beds was booked. Problem was sorted out instantaneously and without fuss. Reception staff extremely efficient, helpful and friendly. Dined in the hotel several evenings and found food and service to be of a high standard although menu is somewhat limited. If peckish there is a Burger King just past the S-Bahn station to the left of the hotel and a coffee bar/cafe at the groundfloor entrance to the S-Bahn station for small pastries, snacks, soft drinks etc. Rates in the restaurant seemed to be resonable and a nice wine list at moderate rates. I was puzzled that German wines seemed more expensive than French or even Australian. Dining room and bar staff were just as efficient and friendly as reception staff -- consistently helpful and friendly -- very impressive indeed. The hotel looks quite drab from the exterior but is fresh, modern and extremely pleasant in the interior. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anybody who wishes to have a pleasant stay in Berlin in a good location at a very reasonable rate with a hight standard of service and accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sjrobertson
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out of this hotel, and must say that I had a great time here. Great location, parallel to the Brandenburg Gate at the other end of Tiergarten. There is a bahn (train) station directly in front of the hotel, making it only a few minutes away from the centre of town. The hotel room was peaceful and relaxing, great selection in the mini bar, lots of space and lovely shower. There is a sauna on the 6th floor, along with lots of relaxation treatments, massages, a gym and sun deck balcony. The staff were extremely friendly on every occasion, the breakfast which I got included with my deal at Opodo.co.uk was great. 6am - 10.30am. If youre feeling a little peckish for a burger, there is also a Burger King over the road. On checking out, there is a room where your luggage will be stored, with tickets so you can do something during the day before your flight. I would definitley recommend this hotel, good cost, good location and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Icht Bin Ein Novotel Berlinner!”
Reviews.Author: ajenk
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault it at all - clean rooms, excellent staff (who all spoke English) and great location. Stay there - you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: joanddarryl
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel directly via the Novatel's website for a Friday, Saturday and Sunday in Berlin. Location makes this easy for the driver to find and parking was easy and reasonably priced. Rooms were modern and clean, all the usual facilities are there. Did not dine at the hotel so I am unable to recommend this aspect, but we did have a few drinks at the bar before heading out at nights. Seemed to be a very popular business persons hotel Train station is within 100 metres and this makes the hotel very easy for travel to any part of Berlin. Caught taxi's at night and they all knew of the hotels location so we didnt feel if we were being ripped off Quite a large flea market occurs on the weekend right in front of the hotel that makes for interetesing browsing. Overall the hotel was high quality, the rooms large enough and very comfortable, the location is excellent and the price we booked for on the net was excellent. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Children Controlling the Business Centre Computers”
Reviews.Author: lenalena123
Reviews.Content: Great location and fantastic breakfast (maný reviews said to skip this but we found the hotel to have a comprehensive offering). Two problems: computer access and TV channel choices. There is no CNN or BBC offering so that there is really no way you can be in touch with the news if you don't speak German. While the hotel is kind enough to offer 2 computers in their "business centre", this centre is in the lobby next to the kiddie area. The policý of the hotel is for persons over the age of 16 to use the computer, but every time one goes down to the "computer area" there are children under this age on the two computers. Finally you may get a computer, but don't be surprised if some kids show up and start harrasing you to get off the computer. It is an outrageous situation that I have not experienced anywhere in the world. The hotel should give a password out to guests that check-in or at least program a time-out to avoid this frustrating situation.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and a great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Francescini
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my company and so was therefore not expecting much as they usually go for the cheapest place. However, even though this was cheap it was very cheerful. I thought that being new nade it all the better but I got an excellent nights sleep, found the facilities fine and like others, can agree with more detailed reviews ahead of mine. Beware of the location though, the S Ban is very helpful but there is a 8 lane main road outisde the hotel. You can't hear it through the windows but I can imagine in the summer it might be annoying if you like to sleep with windows open. A great place though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MarkerMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week during a business/tourist trip. The room looked exactly like other Novotels I have stayed in. All of the furnishings were very new and modern. The location was great, since the Tiergarten S-bahn station is right across the street. If you get a tourist pass, you can get to all of the major tourist sites in under ten minutes. The restaurant was excellent, if a bit spendy. I had a couple of dinners there, and everything I tried was tasty. The only downside to the stay was the ridiculously expensive and slow internet (20 euros/24 hours), and there was some noise from the squeaky stairwell door down the hall. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_J_B
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Novotel's I've stayed in. The location is good - quiet at night, but right next to the S Bahn station with easy links all over the city. There is a shop in the station where you can buy cold drinks and snacks which are cheaper than using the mini bar. There's also a good licensed restaurant/cafe open all day from breakfast, called the Giraffe, with a nice outside seating area. Its just under the railway arch past the back of the local burger king. There is also a flea market right outside the hotel on Saturday and Sunday - a bit junky but interesting to wander around. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are a very good size and offered separate shower and bath. A couple of things to note: We were a group of 6 people and the lifts will only let you travel to the floor that your room key is programmed to which can be a bit annoying. The aircon is a bit tame on a hot day and the bar prices are a little steep. However the bar area is lovely and there's outdoor seating too. All in all, a very good choice at a very reasonable price. You could do a lot worse. I probably wouldn't recommend for those wanting to be in the middle of the night life though.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: alexDenver
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Berlin and chose this hotel instead of those arranged by the conference. The rates were actually better than the conference discount, and I think the hotel was generally better, too. (I booked through the hotel website. Bring your confirmation page to prove your discount.) This is a very modern hotel with good sized rooms (a couch as well as a bed), an easy to use safe in room, as well as a small fridge (it's full, with beer, juice, soda, water, etc., but you can take theirs out and put yours in if you like). The windows open, and if you ask for the quiet side of the hotel, you get a nice park-like view as well as a nice breeze. The young staff was cordial and capable. All speak English as well as German. The breakfast "buffet" was really a banquet and the quality of the food is excellent. There are more than 50 items to choose from. Germans like breakfast and you can have several, since many go back for seconds (and skip lunch). It's worth doing once to see if you like it. There are cheap breakfasts nearby, too. I did room service twice and it was prompt and had very good food and wine both times. The hotel is next to the beautiful Tiergarten park (with a cafe in it) and is also right next to an S-Bahn (elevated rail) stop that has several lines running to it. If you like, you can even travel directly to Potsdam from this S-Bahn stop. Very convenient to the whole city and makes it very safe to come home even if its late and you are alone. (Great restaurants at Savigny-Platz are only two stops away.)There is also a city taxi stand outside the hotel and the airport is only about 25 minutes away. I enjoyed staying here and would choose it again for both quality and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpr78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply great, even though they tried to charge me for a breakfast i didnt have. This was however solved pretty quickly after they checked the signatures and they didnt match... Beware of the breakfast costing you a smaller fortune at €17. Try the pastry shop under the Tiergarten S-bahn Station for breakfast or take the train to Zoologischer garten. The location is right besides (25meters) the Tiergarten S-bahn station. (One stop from Zoologischer garten, 2minute ride) Beware that the closest U-Bahn station is a good 400-500m away even though is seems closer on most maps. The hotel seems to have a pretty good isolation though, since i couldnt hear the frequent traintraffic until opening the window. There is really nothing "bad" to be said about this hotel. Working AC. Clean new/refurbished rooms. Excellent service. Very stylish and clean bathroom and WC. (They were separate, excellent!) And as i stated the isolation in the hotel is good, I was convinced for a few days that we were the only ones living on the whole floor even though my girlfriend claimed otherwise. Burger King is about 100meters away if You need a quick meal. And a few tips: You need the keycard to operate the elevator. You NEED to use your keycard to get it to stop at the right floor. If Your are staying at floors 1 or 2, it might make sense to use the stairs (also requires keycard) even though the hotel staff doesnt seem too happy about it as it seems to be there just for evacution purposes.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: generx
Reviews.Content: Booked a room last minute since we had to catch flight out of Berlin. Rate was €140 ($186USD) probably because the hotel was full. Was well worth it, staff was friendly, accommodating, and efficient. Restaurant and bar looked nice but did not sample the food since there are many other restaurants in the city (Vivolo has great Tapas!) Train station is literally 25 paces outside the lobby and across the street, extremely convenient if arriving by train or just to get around by train since traffic can be hell some days. It's 2 stops from the Berlin Central Station (Hauptbahnhof or Hbf) a day pass is around €6 and is the quickest way to get around. The trains are really easy to figure out for any first timer and the automated ticket dispensers can display in different languages including English. The lobby was modern, I believe the hotel opened last year so everything still looked fairly new. May seem cold/trendy/corporate for some but I prefer it. The room was on the 4th floor, a decent size (comparable to most non-suites in US chain hotels) and yes, a minibar! Had the usual assortment of chocolates, juice, beer, water, coke, and even diet coke (no wine) It had a small safe, coffee/tea maker, desk, and TV. There was also a separate table and chair next to the bedside as well as a tiny closet and suitcase valet. The room was very clean, bathroom and shower were also clean. There is a separate bathtub from the shower stall as well as a separate toilet. A nice touch was the speaker in the bathroom with separate volume control so that you can listen to music (TV doubles as a radio and alarm clock) AC was strong and fan was quiet although I had to crank up the settings manually. Sound insulation was awesome and did not hear a thing all night from the hall or from the next rooms. Bed was comfy with a large duvet. Taxi was around €14 to Tegel Airport (TXL) and took about 15 minutes with no traffic since it was a Saturday morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the location, amenities, and professionalism of the staff. Price was fair and location was great, not "out of the way" at all. I plan to stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Novotel hit the spot”
Reviews.Author: Manto1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Novotel which is just on the Western edge of Berlin's famous Tiergarten. Overall I was very impressed by the facilities, the room was large and very clean, with an ensuite plus, unusually, a seperate WC, which could be really handy if there were more than one person sharing the room. The room also featured a mini bar and safe (my only gripe is that there was no wine in the mini bar, only beer, but I ate in the hotel restaurant, and the staff were happy for me to bring the remains of a bottle up to my room, so this was really not a big problem). On checkout I was advised that the first item out of the minibar is gratis - gotta love a freebie! I made use of the gym section of the "fitness centre" on level 6, which was bright and airy but doesn't have a huge range of gym equipment, however, for the three days I was there it did the trick. If you enjoy a run, you could use the Tiergarten on your doorstep. My only gripes would be that there was no iron in the room, however, there is a laundry room on level 3 which the staff will give you a key card for on request. Also, the pillows on the bed were really better described as cushions in pillow cases, and there were only two English channels on the TV, BBC News 24 and CNN. However, I didn't go to Berlin to watch TV and I did find a good radio station to listen to when I got tired of hearing the same story on BBC News 24 for the sixty third time. I made full use of the hotel restaurant, as after each day of sightseeing, I was too tired to go out again, and it was just easier as a lone traveller to eat in house. The food was great and the waitress very friendly and attentive, although it was by no means very busy during my stay. The hotel bar was a nice quiet spot to sit and enjoy a pre dinner drink and has a happy "hour" each night. The rate I got from the hotel website, 108 Euros per night, included an excellent buffet breakfast, and I thought the price was really great value, considering what you'd pay for a similar place in London or Paris. The hotel is located about 100 metres from Tiergarten S-Bahn station, which was fantastic for getting around the city. The Riechstag and Pottsdamer Platz are just the other side of the Tiergarten, about 40 mins walk. I would recommend the Novotel am Tiergarten to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzimac
Reviews.Content: Have to confess that when I booked this hotel I expecting it to be a bit "faceless" being part of a large chain. Also wasn't entirely sure if location was good for our purposes as others had said it was in the diplomatic area. So I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised when we got to Berlin and got off the train at Tiergarten (flew with Easyjet so train straight from airport to hotel) only to find that the hotel was right beside the train stop. So whole experience of arrival was remarkably stress free. Hotel itself is large and the foyer is spacious so gives an impressive first impression. Rooms large, clean and comfortable. So we were off to a good start. Our first night we found we had to walk a bit to find a place to eat, so we learned to just jump on the train and go to other parts of the city to find things. Trains so good that this is no problem at all to do - and in fact encourages you to explore the city more than you might if a lot on your doorstep. Breakfast varied and tasty. Staff friendly and efficient, with everyone speaking perfect English (again my embarrassing lack of German). I'd stay again if I went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: prash123
Reviews.Content: Honestly - you would be foolish not to stay here. This hotel is simply awesome value for money. I stayed here for christmas - 26 GBP a night!!!. And the hotel is really modern and kept wonderfully warm. Rooms were extremely spacious with superb modern decor. I don't know what people are talking about the location of this hotel. It is bang next to the station - Tiergarten. Berlin trains are excellent and in 3-4 min you'll be in Alexanderplatz or zoologischer garder or somewhere .. The only catch to the hotel is - avoid breakfast. It is far too dear and is not included in the cost of the room. We didn't have breakfast here but on our last day - sat down for a nice dinner. Well worth it! And yes - don't forget to walk to the Victory column and go right to the top. PS: There's a burger king (or mac d) right next to Tiergarten station. Spend your christmas in Berlin - you'll never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Bargain hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: This is how all Novotel Novation hotels should be. I really could not fault this at all. Got a fantastic rate of GBP25.00 per night on [--] and this is brilliant value for money especially when one thinks of how overpriced UK hotels are compared to what you can get in Berlin. Hotel is situated on Strasse des 17 Juni right by Tiergarten S-Bahn station. Having stayed in a few Berlin Hotels, this is no problem to get around anywhere regardless of the other reviews you may have read on here about this being out of the way. The Hauptbahnof is 5 minutes away, Alexanderplatz is 10 mins away. Bahnhof Zoo is 2 mins away by S-Bahn. If this is out of the way, i dread to think what areas like Pankow, Wilmersdorf and Charlottenberg are for some people!! Hotel lobby and corridor areas are modern, although in typical Novotel standard they are modern without being too flashy. The rooms are of a nice standard about 27 Square metres, with TV, honesty minibar, Tea and coffee making facilities, shower and seperate bath. Seperate toilet too in the room. Plenty of storage space, In room safe and a quiet interior room, I really couldn't fault this at all. For a hotel amongst the same star rating as the Park Plaza WallStrasse, its not as nice , but its equally on a par with the Park Inn in Alexanderplatz or the Novotel Berlin Mitte or Suitehotel at Potsdammer Platz. Rack rate at this hotel is about 145EUR per night which is reasonable considering what you are getting. Try getting a similar standard in a UK hotel for the same price turning up on the day! Top tip is to skip the buffet breakfast at 17 Euro and go across to the Wiener Fierbacker across the road and have a continental breakfast for a 2-3 Euros. This is without doubt the best Novotel I have had the pleasure of staying in

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JMRNorway
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned home after a few days in Berlin. It's our second visit to Berlin, so we already knew the city when we arrived this time. Last visit we stayed at a hotel on/by Alexanderplatz, but this time I found a hotel on the web situated about 1,2 km south of there. That meant it was a bit closer to Unter den Linden, the museum island and the rest of the sights in the eastern part of Berlin. The hotel is situated in Fischerinsel, close to the Nikolai viertel, which is a tourist sight in itself. It's mainly a business hotel, but it worked well for us too. Good size on the room, and it had a sofa and a small table, and a nice, clean bathroom with a combined bath-tub and shower. The bed was a bit on the hard side, but ok. The staff was friendly, and helpful. We would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenience and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: JJMandS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days at half term and were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. The rooms were well designed, spacious and comfortable. Despite overlooking the main road and the station (more of that later), double glazing ensured there was no noise. A kettle, tea bags,coffee etc were provided and there was a small mini bar. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, giving advice on restaurants, tourist attractions, trains etc. Due to our delayed arrival, we ate in the hotel's restaurant the first night and enjoyed it very much. Food was tasty and beautifully presented. Very taken with the translation of pak choi as 'anti tank gun choi - a literal translation! There was a great choice for breakfast of hot and cold buffet, plus fruits,cereals, breads etc. Worth the money. From Schoenefeld airport, the S9 train goes directly from platform 13 to the Tiergarten station, just over the road from the hotel. A City tour ticket is worth buying - 19 Euros for three days unlimited travel and reductions on entry prices to some attractions. Trains from the Tiergarten station are every five minutes or so, giving you easy access to the whole city. Try the area round Sauvignyplatz for good little bars and restaurants (we ate at Jules Verne). Morning coffee in the Hotel Adlon by the Brandenburg Gate gives you an idea of where the rich and famous hang out. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: imcdonald5
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our 7-year-old daughter stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in mid-February 2007. The rooms are quite large and the fold-down bed which my daughter used was surprisingly comfortable. My daughter unfortunately was ill for the last 3 days and the hotel could not have been better or more helpful. The reception staff were terrific and the room cleaners were also very helpful and cooperative. We were leaving on an afternoon flight and the hotel told us we could keep the room without charge for as long as we needed it before leaving for the airport. We started in a 1st floor room but asked to be moved as the heating didn't work too well. We were moved to a room on the 5th floor. The only complaint I have about the hotel is that they have a fitness centre on the 6th floor, so avoid rooms on the 5th floor in the area of 531 as the sound of vigorously exercising teutons can be a bit of a pest. Otherwise all was well. Kettle, tea and coffee are provided. There is an S-Bahn station across the road which gets you into the centre of the city in 10 minutes for 2.10 euros. You can walk there in half an hour or 45 minutes through Tiergarten. The Zoo and Kurfurstendamm is a 10 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Mimi07Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: It was not easy to find a hotel in Berlin over New Year but the Dorint Novotel did absolutely meet our expectations! We booked a comfortable (executive) room in which a basket of fruit was waiting for us as well as bathrobes and slippers (the room was spacious, windows could be opened, bathtub). This was great after a long journey! A well equipped fitness as well as sauna and steambath can be used. Breakfast is Euro 17 and good. Enough choice of food and drinks. The hotel is located just opposite Tiergarten S-Bahn, in two stops you are at HauptBahnhof. You can also walk to Brandenburger Tor (about 30min), which is a nice walk down the road. We can highly recommend this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Berlin Am Tiergarten
HotelInfo.Address: Strasse des 17 Juni 106-108, 10623 Berlin, Germany
